items.title: Key takeaways from mixed December jobs report
items.standfirst: The Bureau of Labor Statistics reports the U.S. added 50,000 jobs in December, which is lower than analysts had expected. However, the unemployment rate dropped slightly to 4.4%. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady has more.
items.content: The Bureau of Labor Statistics reports the U.S. added 50,000 jobs in December, which is lower than analysts had expected. However, the unemployment rate dropped slightly to 4.4%. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady has more.

items.title: Trump ramps up Greenland threats and says US will intervene ‘whether they like it or not’
items.standfirst: US president doubled down on threats to acquire territory at a White House meeting with oil and gas executivesDonald Trump has doubled down on his threats to acquire Greenland, saying that the US is “going to do something [there] whether they like it or not.”Speaking at a meeting Friday with oil and gas executives in the White House, the US president justified his comments by saying: “If we don’t do it, Russia or China will take over Greenland. And we’re not going to have Russia or China as a neighbor.” Continue reading...
items.content: US president doubled down on threats to acquire territory at a White House meeting with oil and gas executivesDonald Trump has doubled down on his threats to acquire Greenland, saying that the US is “going to do something [there] whether they like it or not.”Speaking at a meeting Friday with oil and gas executives in the White House, the US president justified his comments by saying: “If we don’t do it, Russia or China will take over Greenland. And we’re not going to have Russia or China as a neighbor.” Continue reading...

items.title: Trump promises oil companies ‘total safety’ in Venezuela as he urges them to invest billions
items.standfirst: Country is ‘uninvestable’ today, president told, but CEOs signal they are ready to spend with supportDonald Trump promised oil giants “total safety, total security” in Venezuela in an effort to persuade them to invest $100bn in the country’s infrastructure after US forces toppled Nicolás Maduro from power.At a roundtable press conference at the White House on Friday afternoon with more than a dozen oil executives, including leaders from Chevron, ExxonMobil and ConocoPhilips, the US president doubled down on claims that Maduro’s arrest presents American oil companies with an unprecedented opportunity for extraction. Continue reading...

Trump Says He’ll Get Deal on Greenland, ‘Easy Way’ or ‘Hard Way’
Trump takes questions on deadly ICE shooting, Greenland and more after meeting with oil executives
items.standfirst: President Trump took questions from reporters at the White House on Friday after meeting with executives of oil and gas companies. The president spoke on a range of topics, from the deadly Minneapolis ICE shooting to Iran and Greenland. CBS News White House reporter Aaron Navarro joins with his takeaways.

items.title: ICE officer's cell phone video shows new angle of Renee Good shooting
items.standfirst: A new cell phone video has surfaced in the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good by ICE officer Jonathan Ross. CBS News correspondent Ash-har Quraishi reports from Minneapolis. Then, Minnesota-based attorney and legal analyst Joe Tamburino joins to discuss the federal takeover of the investigation.
items.content: A new cell phone video has surfaced in the fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good by ICE officer Jonathan Ross. CBS News correspondent Ash-har Quraishi reports from Minneapolis. Then, Minnesota-based attorney and legal analyst Joe Tamburino joins to discuss the federal takeover of the investigation.

items.title: New video and angle of Minneapolis ICE shooting lead-up shared by White House
items.standfirst: Warning: video might be disturbing. New video shared by Vice President JD Vance reveals a new angle of the shooting of 37-year-old Renee Nicole Good, the woman killed by an ICE officer on Wednesday. A source says the new video comes from the ICE agent who fired the fatal shots. CBS News' Anna Schecter has more.

items.title: Renee Nicole Good said ‘I’m not mad at you’ before ICE agent shot her, video shows
items.standfirst: Clip first posted by partisan outlet Alpha News shows perspective of ICE agent as Good was fatally shotRenee Nicole Good calmly said everything was “fine” and “I’m not mad at you” seconds before an on-duty Immigration Customs Enforcement agent fatally shot her in Minneapolis as she drove away, according to a cellphone video shared on Friday by Donald Trump’s White House.The partisan media outlet Alpha News first posted the video on X, a 47-second clip that showed the perspective of the ICE agent – and captured a man’s voice calling Good a “fucking bitch” after she was mortally wounded. It was then shared by the White House’s official Rapid Response X account as well as JD Vance, with the vice-president writing in part that he agreed with the notion that Good’s death was “a tragedy” but accused the media of dishonestly covering the circumstances of her killing. Continue reading...
items.content: Clip first posted by partisan outlet Alpha News shows perspective of ICE agent as Good was fatally shotRenee Nicole Good calmly said everything was “fine” and “I’m not mad at you” seconds before an on-duty Immigration Customs Enforcement agent fatally shot her in Minneapolis as she drove away, according to a cellphone video shared on Friday by Donald Trump’s White House.The partisan media outlet Alpha News first posted the video on X, a 47-second clip that showed the perspective of the ICE agent – and captured a man’s voice calling Good a “fucking bitch” after she was mortally wounded. It was then shared by the White House’s official Rapid Response X account as well as JD Vance, with the vice-president writing in part that he agreed with the notion that Good’s death was “a tragedy” but accused the media of dishonestly covering the circumstances of her killing. Continue reading...

items.title: What we know about Renee Good, the driver shot and killed by ICE agent
items.standfirst: Renee Nicole Good, a 37-year-old mother of 3, was shot and killed by an ICE agent in Minneapolis. Her father describes her as warm and witty and someone who cared deeply about others.
items.content: Renee Nicole Good, a 37-year-old mother of 3, was shot and killed by an ICE agent in Minneapolis. Her father describes her as warm and witty and someone who cared deeply about others.

items.title: Meta to Become the Biggest Nuclear Buyer Among Hyperscalers | Bloomberg Tech 1/9/2026
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow discusses Meta’s latest energy deals for AI data centers that will make it the biggest buyer of nuclear power among its hyperscaler peers. Plus, MiniMax, one of China’s largest generative AI startups, goes public in Hong Kong. And, Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy talks about the company’s plan to buy AI-powered observability platform Observe. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow discusses Meta’s latest energy deals for AI data centers that will make it the biggest buyer of nuclear power among its hyperscaler peers. Plus, MiniMax, one of China’s largest generative AI startups, goes public in Hong Kong. And, Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy talks about the company’s plan to buy AI-powered observability platform Observe. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Meta Turns to Multi-Gigawatt Nuclear Deals for AI Data Centers
items.standfirst: Meta aims to future-proof its energy needs by turning to nuclear power in multi-gigawatt deals for AI data centers. Bloomberg’s Riley Griffin discusses Meta’s plan with Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Meta aims to future-proof its energy needs by turning to nuclear power in multi-gigawatt deals for AI data centers. Bloomberg’s Riley Griffin discusses Meta’s plan with Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Snowflake to Buy App Monitoring Program Observe
items.standfirst: Snowflake plans to buy AI-powered app monitoring startup Observe, part of its push to expand in the IT operations management software market. Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy joins Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Snowflake plans to buy AI-powered app monitoring startup Observe, part of its push to expand in the IT operations management software market. Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy joins Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: AI Build-Out Forces Analysts to Cover Entire Supply Chain
items.standfirst: Meta agreed to a series of electricity deals for AI data centers that will make it the biggest buyer of nuclear power among its hyperscaler peers. Paul Meeks, managing director and head of technology research at Freedom Capital Markets, discusses how energy needs and the AI build-out are changing what tech analysts examine. He joins Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Meta agreed to a series of electricity deals for AI data centers that will make it the biggest buyer of nuclear power among its hyperscaler peers. Paul Meeks, managing director and head of technology research at Freedom Capital Markets, discusses how energy needs and the AI build-out are changing what tech analysts examine. He joins Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Meta signs 3 deals for nuclear energy to power AI data centers

items.content: Facebook parent Meta has reached nuclear power deals with three companies as it continues to look for electricity sources for its artificial intelligence data centers.

items.standfirst: Oklo Inc. and Vistra Corp. shares rallied, leading peers higher, after Meta Platforms Inc. agreed to a purchase nuclear power from the companies to run artificial-intelligence data centers.
items.content: Oklo Inc. and Vistra Corp. shares rallied, leading peers higher, after Meta Platforms Inc. agreed to a purchase nuclear power from the companies to run artificial-intelligence data centers.

items.title: Meta Signs Multi-Gigawatt Nuclear Deals to Power AI Data Centers
items.standfirst: Meta Platforms Inc. agreed to a series of electricity deals to power data centers that could end up totaling more than 6 gigawatts, enough to power a city of about 5 million homes. Will Wade reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Meta Platforms Inc. agreed to a series of electricity deals to power data centers that could end up totaling more than 6 gigawatts, enough to power a city of about 5 million homes. Will Wade reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: General Motors reports $7bn earnings loss after pulling back from EVs
items.standfirst: GM says end of tax incentives and less stringent emissions regulations slowed consumer demand for EVs in 2025General Motors said on Thursday it will record a one-time earnings hit of $7.1bn in its quarterly financial results, mostly due to its pullback from electric vehicles in light of shifting US policies.The Detroit auto giant’s fourth-quarter results will be dented by $6bn in charges connected to reversals on EV investments, according to a securities filing. The remaining $1.1bn includes costs from the company’s restructuring of its China operations. Continue reading...
items.content: GM says end of tax incentives and less stringent emissions regulations slowed consumer demand for EVs in 2025General Motors said on Thursday it will record a one-time earnings hit of $7.1bn in its quarterly financial results, mostly due to its pullback from electric vehicles in light of shifting US policies.The Detroit auto giant’s fourth-quarter results will be dented by $6bn in charges connected to reversals on EV investments, according to a securities filing. The remaining $1.1bn includes costs from the company’s restructuring of its China operations. Continue reading...

Walmart-Backed ‘Super App’ OnePay Hits $4 Billion Valuation
items.standfirst: OnePay, the Walmart Inc.-backed fintech firm behind the “super app” that the world’s largest retailer is incorporating for customers, recently bought back shares from employees at a price that values the closely-held company at more than $4 billion, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.
items.content: OnePay, the Walmart Inc.-backed fintech firm behind the “super app” that the world’s largest retailer is incorporating for customers, recently bought back shares from employees at a price that values the closely-held company at more than $4 billion, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

items.title: Hiring slows in December to end the weakest year of job growth since the pandemic
items.standfirst: U.S. employers added 50,000 jobs in December, according to a report from the Labor Department Friday. Measured annually, job gains in 2025 were the slowest since 2020.
items.content: U.S. employers added 50,000 jobs in December, according to a report from the Labor Department Friday. Measured annually, job gains in 2025 were the slowest since 2020. (Image credit: Spencer Platt)
